title: Zillow, State Street, Valneva, Coinbase: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Zillow shares were down after reports that it would stop buying homes this year; Valneva soared on its vaccine test results
text:
* State Street and Albertsons are due to report earnings before the open.

* Crude prices were climbing early Monday, boosting the share prices of producers. Occidental Petroleum gained 1% and Diamondback Energy added 0.9%.

* Bitcoin was trading above $61,000, and digital-wallet provider Coinbase was up more than 1% before the bell.

* U.S.-traded shares of French biotech Valneva soared 41% premarket. It said its coronavirus vaccine candidate outperformed AstraZeneca's in a Phase 3 study, which met both its co-primary endpoints.

* Johnson & Johnson, meanwhile, was flat after a panel of outside doctors and experts voted 19-0 to recommend that all adults who received a first dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine should get the second dose at least two months later.

* Vaccine maker Moderna was down 1.4% premarket. Last week the FDA delayed a decision on making its Covid-19 shot available for adolescents, to assess whether it may lead to heightened risk of a rare inflammatory heart condition.

* Steel Dynamics will report earnings after the close.

Chart of the Day

* Hong Kong started trading in futures tied to an index of stocks from mainland China, giving global investors a new tool for betting on Chinese markets.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com

Zillow, State Street, Valneva, Coinbase: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
